instructions: From any Home screen, tap Applications . Tap Camera . Take a picture or video. Tap the Send Message icon at the top of screen. Tap the account you want to send from. Tap See all to expand full list of available accounts. Follow the instructions for that account. When finished, tap Send .

From any Home screen, tap Applications . Tap Camera . Take a picture or video. Tap the Send Message icon at the top of screen. Tap the account you want to send from. Tap See all to expand full list of available accounts. Follow the instructions for that account. When finished, tap Send

Make sure the SIM card is inserted. Turn on your device and wait for the welcome screen to appear. Tap Start . If necessary, select a Wi-Fi network. Tap Next . Tap Yes to the 'Get Google' screen to set up your Google account. Tap No to create a new Google account. Enter your Google email and password. Tap the arrow in the lower right to advance to the next screen. Tap OK to agree to Google Terms of Service. Select or clear the following Google settings: BACKUP AND RESTORE LOCATION COMMUNICATION Tap the arrow in the lower right to advance to the next screen. If desired, sign into your HTC account. Select one of the following radio button: Get content from your old phone Skip Tap NEXT . Update the Auto sync selections as desired. Tap NEXT . The 'Personalize and secure screen' appears. Enter desired name into PHONE NAME field. If desired tap Screen lock to secure your phone. Follow any additional prompts. Tap NEXT . If desired, select the Allow Diagnostics check box. Tap MORE to learn more about diagnostics. Tap FINISH to complete the initial setup.

Image titled Open a Zip File Step 13 1 Download the Unzip app. This app, which allows you to extract and view ZIP folders' compressed files, is free in the App Store: Open your iPhone's Image titled Iphoneappstoreicon.png App Store . Tap Search . Tap the search bar at the top of the screen. Type in unzip , then tap Search . Tap GET to the right of the "Unzip - zip file opener" heading. Enter your Touch ID, Face ID, or Apple ID password when prompted. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 14 2 Find your ZIP folder. Open the app or location in which your ZIP folder is stored. This step will vary, but common locations for ZIP folders on an iPhone include the following: Email Open your email app (e.g., Gmail or Mail), select the email in which the ZIP folder is stored, and scroll down if necessary to view the ZIP folder's name. Files Tap the Image titled Iphonefilesapp01.png Files app icon, tap Browse , tap the location in which the ZIP folder is located (you may have to navigate through a few different folders). Image titled Open a Zip File Step 15 3 Tap the ZIP folder. Doing so will open the ZIP folder's preview. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 16 4 Tap the "Share" Image titled Iphoneblueshare2.png icon. It's usually in the bottom-right or top-right corner of the screen. This will bring up a menu at the bottom of the screen. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 17 5 Scroll right and tap . You'll find this in the menu's top row of apps. Doing so opens the Unzip app with your ZIP folder in it. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 18 6 Tap your ZIP folder's name. You should see it in the middle of Unzip. This will automatically extract the ZIP folder's contents to a regular folder of the same name. Unfortunately, Unzip doesn't allow you to view the ZIP folder's files without extracting them. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 19 7 Tap the unzipped folder. It's a yellow item with the same name as your ZIP folder. Doing so opens the folder to display your ZIP folder's formerly compressed files. Advertisement

Image titled Open a Zip File Step 20 1 Download the ZIP folder if necessary. If the ZIP folder isn't already on your Android, you should be able to download it by going to its location and tapping its download link. This will place the ZIP folder in your Android's "Download" folder. If the ZIP folder is in Google Drive, long-press the ZIP folder, then tap Download in the resulting menu. If the ZIP folder is in Gmail, tap the "Download" Image titled Android7download.png icon next to the folder's name in the email. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 21 2 Download the WinZip app. You can download the free WinZip app in order to find and extract your ZIP folder: Open the Image titled Androidgoogleplay.png Google Play Store . Tap the search bar. Type in winzip . Tap WinZip - Zip UnZip Tool in the drop-down results. Tap INSTALL . Image titled Open a Zip File Step 22 3 Open WinZip. Tap OPEN on the WinZip page, or tap the WinZip app icon in your Android's App Drawer. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 23 4 Tap when prompted. Doing so lets WinZip access your Android's files. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 24 5 Scroll right and tap . You'll have to scroll through four screens to get to the START button. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 25 6 Select your default storage. Depending on the ZIP folder's location, you'll either tap Internal to select your Android's internal storage or tap SD card (or similar) to access your Android's SD card if available. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 26 7 Open the ZIP folder's location. Go to the folder in which you've saved the ZIP folder. You may have to scroll down to find the correct folder. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 27 8 Select the ZIP folder. Find the ZIP folder in the current location, then tap once the checkbox to the right of its name to select it. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 28 9 Tap the "Unzip" icon. It's a box with a zipper on it at the top of the screen, just left of the empty checkbox. A pop-up menu will appear. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 29 10 Select a folder in which to store the unzipped folder. Tap Storage , tap your preferred storage option (e.g., Internal ), and tap a folder in which you want to extract the ZIP folder. Image titled Open a Zip File Step 30 11 Tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so extracts the ZIP folder's files into your selected folder from which point you should be able to open them. Advertisement
